data.text: The formation or use of words such as buzz or murmur that imitate the sounds associated with the objects or actions they refer to.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A word formed in imitation of the sound of the thing it signifies; an imitative word. See the extract.
The property of a <xref>word</xref> of sounding like what it represents.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: A word that sounds like what it represents, such as "gurgle" or "hiss".
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: The use of language whose sound imitates that which it names.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: using words that imitate the sound they denote
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
